people.title: Manage Conflict
people.deepDive: Conflict is a team performance opportunity. Resolve using situational techniques.
people.veteranTip: PMI wants a win-win. 'Forcing' is only for emergencies.

people.title: Lead a Team
people.deepDive: Adopt servant leadership to empower and remove blockers.
people.veteranTip: Lead by supporting. If you're bossing, you're losing.

people.title: Support Team Performance
people.deepDive: Monitor progress and mentor for continuous improvement.
people.veteranTip: Measure results, not hours. Performance is about value.

people.title: Empower Team Members
people.deepDive: Delegate authority and provide resources for decision-making.
people.veteranTip: Trust but verify. Empowerment fails without clear boundaries.

people.title: Ensure Team is Trained
people.deepDive: Identify skill gaps and provide the necessary learning paths.
people.veteranTip: Training is an investment, not an expense. Budget it early.

people.title: Build a Team
people.deepDive: Focus on the right mix of skills and the transition to a cohesive unit.
people.veteranTip: A group of experts isn't a team. Focus on the 'Storming' phase.

people.title: Address Team Impediments
people.deepDive: Proactively identify and remove obstacles hindering velocity.
people.veteranTip: Your success is measured by how fast you clear the path for others.

people.title: Negotiate Project Agreements
people.deepDive: Establish boundaries and expectations with stakeholders.
people.veteranTip: Negotiation is about building a sustainable partnership.

people.title: Collaborate with Stakeholders
people.deepDive: Align project goals with business needs through relationships.
people.veteranTip: Stakeholders define 'Success'. Don't wait for them to come to you.

people.title: Build Shared Understanding
people.deepDive: Ensure everyone is moving toward the same 'Definition of Done'.
people.veteranTip: Assumed understanding is a silent killer. Verify assumptions constantly.

people.title: Engage Virtual Teams
people.deepDive: Manage distributed teams across time zones.
people.veteranTip: Over-communicate. Silence is a risk in virtual environments.

people.title: Define Team Ground Rules
people.veteranTip: The team must write the rules, or they won't follow them.

people.title: Mentor Stakeholders
people.deepDive: Educate stakeholders on the project process.
people.veteranTip: A project-savvy stakeholder is your best ally.

people.title: Promote Team Performance EI
people.deepDive: Use Emotional Intelligence to improve dynamics.
people.veteranTip: Read the room. If energy is low, pivot your leadership style.

process.title: Execute with Urgency
process.deepDive: Deliver business value faster by identifying fast-track opportunities.
process.veteranTip: Speed requires focus. Don't rush the wrong things.

process.title: Manage Communications
process.deepDive: Ensure the right info reaches the right person at the right time.
process.veteranTip: 90% of your job is communication. Surprises are failures.

process.title: Assess and Manage Risks
process.deepDive: Identify threats and opportunities throughout the lifecycle.
process.veteranTip: A risk log isn't a diary. If there's no owner, it's just a list.

process.title: Engage Stakeholders
process.deepDive: Maintain relationships to ensure project success.
process.veteranTip: Engagement is active. Be proactive with your outreach.

process.title: Plan and Manage Budget
process.deepDive: Determine and monitor costs to stay within authorized funds.
process.veteranTip: Transparency is key. Variance happens; hiding it is the failure.

process.title: Plan and Manage Schedule
process.deepDive: Establish the timeline and ensure milestones are met.
process.veteranTip: The schedule is a steering tool, not a static record.

process.title: Plan and Manage Quality
process.deepDive: Ensure products meet the required standards.
process.veteranTip: Quality is planned in, not inspected in. Rework is expensive.

process.title: Plan and Manage Scope
process.deepDive: Define exactly what is (and isn't) included.
process.veteranTip: Scope creep is a symptom of poor requirements gathering.

process.title: Integrate Project Activities
process.deepDive: Coordinate all moving parts of the project management plan.
process.veteranTip: Integration is the PMâ€™s unique value. You are the glue.

process.title: Manage Project Changes
process.deepDive: Assess impact before taking action on change requests.
process.veteranTip: Never say 'yes' in a meeting. Say, 'Let me assess impact.'

process.title: Manage Procurement
process.deepDive: Acquire necessary materials and teams through formal processes.
process.veteranTip: Treat vendors as partners, not just suppliers.

process.title: Manage Artifacts
process.veteranTip: Documentation is the audit trail of your success.

process.title: Determine Methodology
process.deepDive: Agile, Waterfall, or Hybrid selection based on project needs.
process.veteranTip: Hybrid is often the real-world winner.

process.title: Establish Governance
process.veteranTip: Governance is a safety net, not a bottleneck.

process.title: Manage Project Issues
process.veteranTip: Don't let issues sit. Resolve at the source.

process.title: Knowledge Transfer
process.veteranTip: Capture it as it happens, not at the end.

process.title: Plan Closing
process.deepDive: Formalize project completion and archive records.
process.veteranTip: Closing is a project phase. Don't skip sign-off.

business.title: Manage Compliance
business.deepDive: Ensure project adheres to legal and regulatory standards.

business.title: Evaluate Value
business.deepDive: Confirm project delivers intended business benefits.

business.title: Support Org Change
business.deepDive: Manage the human side of organizational transitions.
business.veteranTip: Change is hard. Communicate the 'Why' early.

business.title: Continuous Improvement
business.deepDive: Refine processes throughout the project lifecycle.
business.veteranTip: Always ask: 'How can we do this better?'

formulas.name: CPI (Cost Performance Index)
formulas.scenario: Your Earned Value (EV) is $200k, but your Actual Cost (AC) is $250k. Status?
formulas.veteranInsight: You are spending $1 to get $0.80 of value. Check for scope creep.

quizPool.question: A team member is consistently late to standups. In a private meeting, they cite personal issues. Your first action?

options.text: Collaborate on a temporary flexible schedule

quizPool.veteranLogic: Retaining talent is cheaper than hiring new talent.

mockExam.question: The project is in closing, but a stakeholder refuses sign-off due to a missing feature. What is your first action?
mockExam.explanation: Acceptance criteria are the legal boundary for project completion.
